meanings.definition: Relating to or marked by aphesis.
meanings.sent1: Her speech was a bit aphetic, with many words left out.
meanings.sent2: The aphetic tone of his writing made it difficult to understand.
meanings.sent3: The aphetic cat meowed softly, missing the end of its words.
meanings.sent4: The aphetic clouds seemed to fade into the sky, leaving only fragments behind.
meanings.sent5: The aphetic painting left out crucial details, creating a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A word or form resulting from aphesis.
meanings.sent1: The linguist studied the aphetic in different languages.
meanings.sent2: She found an interesting aphetic in the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The playful child enjoyed creating new aphetics in her made-up language.
meanings.sent4: The aphetic in the poem added a unique rhythm to the verses.
meanings.sent5: The aphetic at the beginning of the word changed its meaning completely.
